alert.note: Alert for Grant Grove Area; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kings Canyon NP; San Joaquin River Canyon; Sequoia NP; South End of the Upper Sierra; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 9:51PM PST until January 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of up to 10 inches are possible above 4,000 feet. Snow accumulations from 12 to 18 inches are possible at elevations above 6,000 feet. Localized snow amounts of 18 inches or more are possible at elevations above 8,000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Across the Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and wind may adversely impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
